intro: Linum indehiscens, commonly known as the silky flax or yellow flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces slender, branched stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant's most distinctive feature is its silky, hair-like fibers that cover the stems and leaves, giving it a unique appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. The fibers of Linum indehiscens have been used traditionally for various purposes, including textile production and as a source of natural dyes.
